turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of the Poles in the United States.
turn.1: What religious practices did the Poles in the United States adopt?
turn.2: Polish customs taken into American churches include the ' (a midnight mass celebrated between December 24 and 25), the ' (bitter lamentations devotion), and "" (blessing of easter eggs).
turn.3: Did they have any other religious practices?
turn.4: Many Polish Americans were devout Catholics and placed pressure on the Church to have services in Polish and include them in the priesthood and bishopric.
turn.5: Why did they want to change the practices?
turn.6: Polish Americans grew deeply frustrated by their lack of representation in the church leadership; many loyal parishioners were offended that they could not participate in church decision-making or finances.
turn.7: What else is interesting about their religious history?
turn.8: Polish parishioners who collectively donated millions of dollars to construct and maintain churches and parishes in the United States were concerned that these church properties were now legally owned by German and Irish clergy.
turn.10: The Polish-German relations in church parishes was tense during the 19th century.
